title: Iceland rolls out major change to ALL its supermarkets that will make life easier for shoppers
snippet: ICELAND has announced a major change to all its stores which will make shopping easier for customers. This will combine with the retailer’s plans to install thousands of digital screens
content: Iceland rolls out major change to ALL its supermarkets that will make life easier for shoppers The Sun UK Edition US Edition Scottish Sun Irish Sun Search Search Sign in My Account Sun Club The Sun Sun Club News Sport Fabulous TV Showbiz Money Travel Health Motors Tech Royals Wellness Dear Deidre Puzzles Betting Shopping Topics A-Z More More from The Sun Newsletters Deliver my newspaper Dream Team Sun Bingo Sun Jobs Sun Savers £9.50 Hols The Sun Digital Newspaper Fabulous Clothing News Retail Property Tips Business Sun Savers Sun Jobs Money CHECK IT OUT Iceland rolls out major change to ALL its supermarkets that will make life easier for shoppers The roll-out will feature customers' most loved products in store Anna McGovern , News Reporter Published: 12:35, 1 Dec 2025 | Updated: 21:16, 1 Dec 2025 Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window) Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) ICELAND has announced a major change to all its stores which will make shopping easier for customers. This will combine with the retailer’s plans to install thousands of digital screens across its stores. Sign up for the Money newsletter Thank you! Email address Please provide a valid email. Your info will be used in accordance with our Privacy Policy You'll now receive top stories, breaking news, and more, straight to your email. 4 Popular Iceland ‘supersized’ products will be displayed in all stores Credit: Iceland Retail Media Iceland has revealed it is rolling out “supersized” 3D hanging signs of popular food products in every single store. The signs are being hung from the ceiling or positioned in “high-impact locations” in the aisle of Iceland and Food Warehouse stores. Current examples on display include a hanging jump multipack of Velvet toilet roll, Walkers 20-pack boxes and a giant Tomato Ketchup bottle. The frozen foods specialist is also using the signs to market their own label lines, including advertising back bacon rashers and its big value packs of frozen sliced chicken breast. Read more on Money LAST CHANCE Our pick of the 28 best LIVE Cyber Monday offers to shop before midnight FESTIVE FEAST I made Christmas dinner with ALL the trimmings for £11 and anyone can do it The oversized cardboard fixtures are among several new in-store retail activations Iceland is offering to suppliers through its in-house retail media business , launched earlier this year. Posting on LinkedIn , Iceland Retail Media shared: “These giant 3D Hanging Signs recently launched in-store, enabling featured products to rise above the competition and command attention from the moment shoppers walk in. “These supersized installations are a perfect example of the bespoke, high-impact activations we can deliver.” 4 Will these “supersized” signs by Iceland make your shopping easier? Credit: Iceland Retail Media The latest propositions stem from Iceland’s growing partnership with Leeds-based retail media consultancy Gig Retail, formed in May. Most read in Money RISKY BUSINESS Iconic UK fast food chain warns of closures & jobs being axed after £8m loss TO YOUR BENEFIT Millions on Universal Credit to get EXTRA payment this week GOOGLE'S OUTFOXED Foxes have beaten Google to roof of its new £1billion 'landscraper' HQ CASHING OUT Major British bank is shutting SIX branches this month - is one going near you? Gig, which specialises in retail media planning and strategy, has been supporting Iceland in on-boarding new suppliers to its retail media network. In March, Iceland launched a major initiative to boost revenue through retail media, establishing its first in-house retail media team led by former category manager Adam Smith. Featured in the Grocer was Rich Ford , creative director of the retail design agency Sherlock Studio , who said: “It chimes with the recent OOH advertising trend for playing with scale. “These are fun, inventive, refreshingly different and quite artistic and I’d say it’s a simple but innovative use of retail media.” Digital screens and onl
